intro: Bupleurum odontites var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate toothed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with serrated edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
